input_text:
Job Title: IIB integration Lead

Location: Erie, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Position: IIB integration LeadLocation: Erie, PA (On-Site)Duration: Full Time MUST - IBM Web Sphere message broker tool, DataPower and API Connect   Job Description:Design, Develop and Test Service Oriented Applications (SOA), Java/J2EE applications using IBM API Connect, IBM WebSphere ESB(DataPower), WebSphere Message Broker, IIB, BPM, Java Script, XSLT, yaml.Develops program logic for new, moderately complex applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications, creates detailed integration analysis documents for integration interfaces.Analyzing & capturing the Business requirements, Functional requirements, Use case preparation, UML, and Business Flow diagrams.Implements and verifies a complete unit test. Codes, tests, debugs, documents, implements, and maintains software applications. Analyzes requirements and maintains, tests, and integrates application components.Develop integration SOA, RESTful services and Libraries using IBM Integration Bus & IBM DataPower.Create an integration services/APIs test suite and executing through service testing tools such as Soap UI, RFHUtil & PostmanResponsible for creating integration packages for IBM Integration Bus, IBM DataPower and API Connect components using SCM tools such as Git and GITLAB.Deploy IBM Integration Bus, IBM DataPower components and API packages through GITLAB and Urban Code.Develop IBM IAA mapping designs by identifying the Mapping/Xpath for all interface specific attributes and documenting them in mapping design documents.Responsible for creating development artifacts for integration interfaces using IBM Web Sphere message broker tool, DataPower and API Connect and responsible for unit test integration components using service testing tools (Soap UI, RFHUtil & Postman)Support product, integration, and target teams during integration and system acceptance testing phase, Design & create integration analysis documents.Participate in team reviews, meetings, and discussions during various phases of the project.Review analysis, design, development, and testing artifacts with product, data, and target teams.Involve in triaging the Production issues with Infrastructure team to determine the flaw in business flow. Monitor entire trace of the Application Transactions, Infrastructure, Data using the Industry Best tools i.e., IBM.Deliver API Design specifications, IAA mapping designs, target system mapping designs, develops program logic for new, moderately complex applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: IIB integration Lead
tools_and_technologies: IBM Web Sphere message broker tool
job_responsibilities: Design, Develop and Test Service Oriented Applications (SOA), Java/J2EE applications using IBM API Connect, IBM WebSphere ESB(DataPower), WebSphere Message Broker, IIB, BPM, Java Script, XSLT, yaml.
Develops program logic for new, moderately complex applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications, creates detailed integration analysis documents for integration interfaces.
Analyzing & capturing the Business requirements, Functional requirements, Use case preparation, UML, and Business Flow diagrams.
Implements and verifies a complete unit test. Codes, tests, debugs, documents, implements, and maintains software applications.
Analyzes requirements and maintains, tests, and integrates application components.
Develop integration SOA, RESTful services and Libraries using IBM Integration Bus & IBM DataPower.
Create an integration services/APIs test suite and executing through service testing tools such as Soap UI, RFHUtil & Postman.
Responsible for creating integration packages for IBM Integration Bus, IBM DataPower and API Connect components using SCM tools such as Git and GITLAB.
Deploy IBM Integration Bus, IBM DataPower components and API packages through GITLAB and Urban Code.
Develop IBM IAA mapping designs by identifying the Mapping/Xpath for all interface specific attributes and documenting them in mapping design documents.

Responsible for creating development artifacts for integration interfaces using IBM Web Sphere message broker tool, DataPower and API Connect and responsible for unit test integration components using service testing tools (Soap UI, RFHUtil & Postman).
Support product, integration, and target teams during integration and system acceptance testing phase, Design & create integration analysis documents.
Participate in team reviews, meetings, and discussions during various phases of the project.
Review analysis, design, development, and testing artifacts with product, data, and target teams.

Involve in triaging the Production issues with Infrastructure team to determine the flaw in business flow. Monitor entire trace of the Application Transactions, Infrastructure, Data using the Industry Best tools i.e., IBM.

Deliver API Design specifications, IAA mapping designs, target system mapping designs, develops program logic for new, moderately complex applications or analyzes and modifies logic in existing applications.

other.content: Position: IIB integration LeadLocation: Erie, PA (On-Site)
